(Note: When set-up as a double, the bed will take up most of the space in the room, though you may push it back into a twin for more space during the day.)  We provide you with your own set of house k
neighborhood_overview: Please check our Guidebook to see recommendations for places to visit in our neighborhood!
notes: PLEASE NOTE: when the Ikea day bed is pulled out into a double there is a weight limit of 225lbs per person. ADDITIONALLY: We have another private bedroom in our home also listed on Airbnb. We verify all our guests through the site and guests will have keys to lock their bedroom doors. We find most guests rarely meet as everyone is out seeing the city! If you are interested in checking out our other room, please use the following link: https://airbnb.com/rooms/135393?s=8&user_id=663764&ref_device_id=834476da76042c7d3d85486a5eaac86e8cc4de3b
transit: Our apartment is one block away from the 2 and 5 express subway lines, which can take you to Downtown Manhattan (Battery Park, Wall St, etc) in 20-25 minutes, to Mid-town Manhattan in 30-40 min, and to many of Brooklyn's best sites in just 10-15 minutes. (Note: directions will be provided by AirBnb on the itinerary you are sent following booking.)
access: Our home includes: - high-speed Wi-Fi - large washer & dryer - bathtub/shower - fully-equipped kitchen - living & dining room - Apple TV with Hulu, Netflix, & HBO - library of books and vast movie & music collection - hardwood floors throughout
interaction: We have been hosting on Airbnb since 2011 and have really enjoyed sharing our home with visitors from other cities and countries   Since we don't travel as much now that we have children we love that people from all over bring the flavors of their culture into our home when they come to stay with us.  ;) We are friendly and would be happy to share our love of New York with you during your stay. With our backgrounds as a licensed NYC tour guide and a member of multiple theatrical and performance unions, as well as our own general passions and interests, we are very knowledgeable about theatre, film, jazz, art and science museums, public parks, historical and cultural landmarks and other ins-and-outs about the city, and we would be glad to give you tips on (for example) standby tickets for The Book of Mormon, the best options for Monday night jazz, or how to get discounted entry to the Met and other museums. If our schedules allow and guests have an interest, we welcome conversation over
house_rules: Our apt is 2k. When you arrive, buzz 2k from the lobby! Once inside the apartment, please take off your shoes and leave them by the front door. Whenever you leave our home or return, please lock the front door behind you.  Our home is strictly non-smoking.  Please do not take any showers between 645am and 745am as we need to get in and out of the bathroom to get kids off to school.  If you are using the AC in your room, just make sure and turn it off when leaving for the day. (Unless you'll only be gone a short while. It's just too expensive to cool an empty room!) Also, please turn off lights in your room if you are leaving for a significant amount of time. If you would like to use the washer and dryer, please talk to me first. Our washer uses concentrated soap and the dryer filter needs to be changed before each load. Let me show you the basics (soap, filter, etc.) It'll be quick and easy. ;) (Here's a suggestion, Not a rule ;) If you arrive into JFK or LGA, take a cab not an Uber. U

host.host_location: New York, New York, United States
host.host_about: Joshua is a writer originally from the Atlantic City area and Karen is an actress,designer,improviser originally from a small town in southeastern Oklahoma. We love film, theatre, music, travel, and nyc and are always up for a lively discussion! We have been hosting on Airbnb since 2011 and really enjoy the opportunity to host such a wide variety of guests!

reviews.comments: The reservation was canceled 27 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

This was our second time staying with Karen and her family.  As was our previous experience, Karen was a great host, the room was clean and set up for us.  Karen is super helpful, always offering great advice and her place is very close to the subway. 

We returned specifically because of our great experience last time and we would definitely do it again!
Karen & Joshua are great hosts! Very helpful, easy going, open minded and respectful. The apartment is nice and near the subway. So lovely family! Thank you!!!

We enjoyed our stay at Karen and Joshua's. They had lots of tips and advices about what to do and see.
Placed closed to the subway and Prospect Park, made it a perfect location for us.
The family was talkative, but respectfully to the need of privacy.

Karen and Joshua were great hosts. Eventhough we only booked the room a couple of hours before our check-in, everything was arranged perfectly. Everything is exactly as described. The house was clean, neat and close to the subway.

We were happy we could stay with this lovely family. When we go back to New York we would definitely stay here again! Thank you Karen and Joshua.

L'ambiance du quartier nous a au début un peu surpris mais finalement aucun problème. Nos hôtes on été très accueillant même en arrivant a 1h du matin! 2 charmants bambins et un couple disponible mais pas dans nos pattes ce qui nous a permis d'aller et venir à notre guise !
Merci à eux

Karen and Joshua were fantastic hosts! I staid a short three nights. They were flexible, kind, respectful and reliable. No problem for checking in, even if I was delayed because of the bus. No rush for the check out. The room and the bed were comfortable, clean, quite perfect for what I was looking for. And for sure, having groceries, a train station and restaurants near their place was great. Nothing to complain, I appreciated my stay.

Karen and Joshua were very welcoming, and helpful when it came to information about travel, what to do and our arrival and departure times. Despite being not that close to Manhattan, and being quite small for 2 people, it was perfect for our stay. Having WiFi also made our stay very easy.

I enjoyed my stay with Karen and Joshua. They were both very kind and helped me with directions for getting around the city when I needed it. It was my second time being in New York City and my first time using Airbnb and I'm glad everything worked out smoothly.
Everything was completely fine. Hosts were very hospitable.

Karen and Joshua could not have been more gracious hosts. As advertised, they offered a private and very cozy room and gave full access to their kitchen and facilities.  They were friendly and seemed always ready to be of help if I needed it.  Moreover, they had it worked out almost to the last detail:  when I arrived they already had neat packages, clearly labelled, of take-out menus for area restaurants, they had directions to local shops and businesses - all of which were in walking distance, and they had clear directions to the nearby subways, and there was a list of house rules - none of which were unacceptable. Overall, it was like spending a weekend at a friend's place.  The neighborhood was quite busy with people and shops until late into the night, but the room was quiet, clean and comfortable.  I slept like a baby.  I would only suggest that you confirm your check in and check out times with them in advance so as to avoid any confusion. I would stay here again if I needed to take another trip to NYC in the future - for sure.

Me and my friend had a very pleasant stay with Karen and Joshua and their two lovely children. It was very special to mingle with this beautiful American family and household. The bed we slept in was more than comfortable and we experienced a lot of space in sharing the kitchen and bathroom. Highly recommended! Great neighborhood too!

My Mom and I had a stop over in NY and stayed at Karen's for one night and it was very nice. I already stayed at Karens place last year and so it was my first choice. The room is clean and the bed is very comfortable. The neighborhood has some nice places to eat and the subway is just around the corner. Karen and Joshua are super nice and Belle and Crockett are really adorable. We enjoyed our short stay and I would definitely stay there again.

Karen and her husband are very nice people and it was a pleasure to stay with them. They were very friendly, helpful and easy-going.

Everything was the way they had depicted it in the description. No bad surprises. The room and the apartment were clean and cosy.

If I should come back to NY, I would try to stay with them again.

Karen had a very quick reaction time when we needed a place to stay last-minute. The room, while small for two people, is inexpensive for the New York area. We were up and about every day we were there though, so it was not a problem. If you are not planning on staying indoors for too long, we would definitely recommend this place!

When we first exited the subway, we found the neighborhood to be somewhat intimidating, though it was later at night. Nothing happened to us, even though we came home late every night. Could be that we just needed to get used to it a little at first.

Karen and Josh were great hosts, talking to us at length on the 
subject of New York and other destinations. Very friendly people.

The room was exactly as described. A nice cozy, comfortable bed to rest my head in between venturing out into Brooklyn and beyond. Karen and Josh were very hospitable and gracious and their kids were awesome too! 
Thanks so much!!!
Appartement très proche du métro et donc très pratique ,hôtes sympatiques et accueillants .Grand lit confortable mais qui occupe presque toute la chambre ...

I stayed 3 nights at Karen and was really happy with my stay. The bedroom was tiny but nice and clean and the apartment very close to the subway and grocery / drugstore / etc. Karen and her husband are kind, respectful and helpful. I would definitely go back and recommend staying with them! 

Je suis restée 3 nuits et j'ai beaucoup apprécié mon séjour. La chambre était petite mais propre et charmante et l'appartement vraiment près du métro et des services. Karen et son maris sont gentils, respectueux et très serviables. J'y retournerais et recommanderais de rester avec eux!

I had a great stay at Karen place and her family. She is very kind and available. She makes you really confortable. Her family is really lovely!
It's easy to go to Manhattan from her place.
I recommend this place to everyone who want to visit New-York.
Thanks

Our stay at Karen´s place was totally with no problems. She was very helpfull, the room was clean and the whole family is friendly. Have no negative feedback, it is also good reachable with the subway. We also come to Newark and left from JFK airport and went to two NHL games in NJ and Nassau, all with no need of cab, everything can be done with cheap and quick transport ;)

The apartment is exactly the way the owners described it: cozy. We definitely enjoyed our stay. Karen and Joshua made us feel welcome and were more than helpful in providing us tips on how to get around the city. The best thing is that the subway is only a block away. Keep in mind that the room is only for sleeping. It is not exactly to hang around and watch TV as one does in hotels. It is simply a room with a bed, a nightstand, and a closet. If you are planning to be all day and night out, then this apartment is perfect.

Notre séjour chez karen c est très bien déroulé, les hôtes sont agréable, et l appartement est très bien. La chambre reste petite mais utilisable. L appartement est bien entretenue.

Cependant le quartier reste incertain et l accès a Manhattan est assez long.

I had to leave early as it was not a good fit nor very comfortable for me:
--child's playroom and kitchen eating area is directly outside your room 
--the loud noise, often adults yelling to each other, begins at 6:30 AM
--child's size bed meant that my feet hung off of the mattress, I'm 5'4"
--prison style pillow--the worst I've ever used and I've been south of the border...I used my towel for support--the towel provided was clean!
--Unless you like Dunkin Donuts coffee--you'll need to take a train or bus at least 1/2 hour to find a 'coffee shop'
--neighborhood is busy but mostly meat shops, fast food and really bad takeout--truly bad for NY standards 
--a food desert for any vegetarian/healthy eater. I did see one 'natural food store' --a hold in the wall that was barely open
--they offer 'kitchen access' but they have the most full refrigerator ever, so I'm not sure where you'd put your stuff 
--I did not mind being the only white person on the bus, street and subway stop, but some people might feel uncomfortable and it is hard to not notice and be conscious about
-the best part about this place is that it is only 2 blocks to the subway it felt safe and I had my pepper spray as I'm city smart

Karen and Josh were very nice and welcoming. Karen gave very good directions on how to get tho their place as well as how to get into the city. Their place is a block away from the subway.The room is cozy and the bed was very warm and comfortable. Thank you so much for your hospitality.
Karen and Josh were great hosts. Would stay there again if i were back in the area.

Great hosts, lovely family, price can't be beat, one block from subway.  Downside: neighborhood.  To get where you want to be, where there's any food, drink, shopping, etc., you'll need to ride two stops+ towards Manhattan, but a small price to pay.

Karen and her husband were great hosts. Kind and welcoming. Their kids are cute as can be (if you don't like kids, this isn't the place for you).   The apartment was small, but when you come to NY you are spending time in the city, not the apartment. There was a subway station right across the street so I was easy to get around. It's in Flatbush, which if you are new to the city might not be the best neighborhood for beginners as it isn't close to many attractions (although Park Slope and Fort Greene are close), but the apartment and neighborhood were both clean and safe. Also, very reasonable price for the city.
Very close to SUNY Downstate, great for interviews or visit to hospital

Karen & Joshua are friendly, communicative and reactive. Bathroom is clean. 
However, inconvenience could be typical of the place of stay:
- Lounge is kept as family room (playground with barriers is amid the area).
- The sleeping room is tight, you could not entirely open up your luggage inside.
- Wake up at 6:30am by yelling little boy each morning

NYC is still gorgeous !
Thibault & Delphine

This was the third time I've stayed with Karen and her family.  The location is super close to the subway and lots of nice markets and stores in and around Nostrand Street.  I was working on research interviews for my PhD dissertation so it was nice to come home to a quiet family atmosphere.  Karen, her husband, and the kids were all so welcoming as usual and it was nice to see them again.  The room was clean and well kept as usual and was perfect for my needs.  It's also a great deal given the cost of living in NYC.

Karen and Joshua where both excellent host, even though my time was short and very sudden my time as a guest was well fulfill. The room was well lit and clean with everything that I possibly can need. First up a pamphlet of rules of the house that had everything that  I needed to know about being a guests in there house, in case they were nowhere to be found. Soap,towel and blankets in case things got a little chilly and the shelf full of books of all kinds some very familia others not so much. Overall I had a pleasant time and I wouldn't mind doing it again.

Karen and Joshua were very gracious hosts. Their place is clean and comfy, and the value of the room is great for anyone visiting NYC. The kids are just adorable and did not bother us at all. Apartment is very close to subway that takes you to prime locations of Manhattan in no time. The neighborhood also had some cute spots, like a juice shop and a cute old-fashioned café/donut shop. We definitely recommend staying with them!

Karen and Joshua are great hosts. I lived there for three nights with my wife and they made our stay really comfortable. Flexible check in, check out times, flexible times to come and leave the room etc. Moreover, the room is located at a very convenient place in Brooklyn. Although I was new to the New York Subways, I didn't have any problem coming to the place every night. 

I would highly recommend the place to everybody and would love to stay there when I'm back in New York!

Karen and Joshua were such welcoming, great hosts. Their kids are just adorable. My friend and I loved staying with them for the weekend. The check-in times are flexible and you can leave/come back at any time. This made our lives so much easier.
The place is cute and clean and about 45 mins away from Times Square, but there is a subway station literally 2 mins away. We would definitely stay with them if we go to NYC again.
Karen's place is delightful with charming children and a very warm welcome.

I stayed at the lovely Family home of Karen and Joshua in brooklyn. The room was cozy and with The kitchen just outside of the room i had all The things i would need at hand. I had The freedom of coming in and leaving The appartment whenever i wanted and when i had questions about NY and it's highlights they where always exited to give me an awnser wich was really nice. Their two kids are adorabele and pretty quiet so it was not a problem at all that they where up early in the morning. I can recommand this BnB to everyone who wants to stay in NY for a while. Kind regards, Tijmen (Son of Rob)

Everything was exactly as advertised. Room was efficiently compact but comfortable and a great deal. Karen was very friendly, easy going, and accommodating. Close proximity to subway station was great. Once we parked the car we did not need it until we checked out. We were able to explore the whole city on public transportation. Great place to hang your hat and crash after a long day out and about.

Eu e meu marido ficamos hospedados durante 15 dias. De modo geral a nossa experiência foi tranquila e agradável. A Karen e o Joshua foram bastante receptivos e atenciosos conosco, sempre nos perguntavam se estávamos bem,  se precisávamos de alguma coisa, se estávamos curtindo a cidade e etc. Eles dão total liberdade para entrada e saída do apartamento em qualquer horário e nos entregaram as chaves logo que chegamos. Sempre saíamos pela manhã e chegávamos de madrugada, circulávamos pelo corredor e utilizávamos o banheiro e nunca tivemos nenhum problema, mesmo porque tomávamos cuidado. O quarto é pequeno, a cama é muito boa, tínhamos travesseiros, cobertas e espaço no armário. A diferença entre as fotos que vemos no anúncio e o apartamento de modo geral é grande, pois existem muito mais móveis e objetos em vários lugares, mas o quarto é exatamente igual, quentinho e aconchegante. As crianças são lindas e comunicativas. Muito fofas!
O bairro é muito legal também, tem mercadinhos, lojinhas de conveniências, farmácia e para os que arriscam, algumas opções para comer. Fica ao lado do metrô (2 and 5 trains), e quando eu digo ao lado, são apenas 3 minutos caminhando do apartamento e 30 minutos de Manhattan (Durante o dia. De madrugada é um pouco mais). Excelente localização! 
Com certeza repetiríamos a experiência! Esperamos voltar muito em breve e adoraríamos que eles nos recebessem. 

Thank you, folks! You are really especial to us! We will never forget. XoXo

Karen is a great host! Made me feel in home all the time, and her kids are very sweet and cute! The bedroom is the same of the pictures, has a great light and the space is confortable, as the bed! The neighborhood is cool, and good to know the real new yorker living style, that I love. I definetely recommend Karen's room to other Airbnb user.
Karen place was really nice. She is a great host and will provide you with information you need to get around NYC. The room is pretty nice and clean. Great host.

This was my second experience with airbnb. I missed to meet Karen and her family but I got chance to see her cat. Having the keys of her apartment was a big responsibility in absence of her. The room was clean and big enough for one person to sleep at night. Being wooden floor, I had to be careful for noise. I'm thankful that Karen managed her friend at her apartment when I arrived at 3:00am. The location and surrounding environment was quiet, I loved her apartment, she has a lot of books. Thanks Karen for having me as a guest.

Tourists like me have lots of queries. In general from my last two weeks of experience with four airbnb hosts, I felt that the presence of the host at least at the moment of check-in and check-out will significantly improve the experience.
Very nice and cozy place to stay, close to public transport and everything you need. Thank you Karen and Joshua :).

We've stayed in Karen's place for 5 days. Karen and Joshua are friendly and welcoming hosts. Their kids and cat are just adorable. My friend and I enjoy staying with them. The check-in times are flexible and the place is clean and cozy which makes us feel like being at home:)

Karen nous à très bien accueillis et l'appartement est tres bien situé pour aller à Manhattan, le metro est à coté.
La chambre est correct pour juste passer les nuits afin de récupérer du long périple dans les rues de new york.
Toutefois l'appartement manque de propreté et de rangement, et le quartier n'est pas le plus sécure, cependant nous n'avons pas eu de probleme!
Ideal pour petit budget ;o)
Todo muy bien lugar limpio buena atención facil acceso a servicio de transporte personas muy agradables buena comunicacion

Karen and her family were really nice. I was only staying two nights, but I felt very much welcome. Everything was as described, the bed was very comfortable. Access by subway was easy. Very recommendable!

Super indico pra quem quer conhecer NYC e gastar bem pouquinho. O quarto é pequeno porém bem limpinho e tem tudo o que você precisa - ventilador, ar condicionado, uma boa cama e espaço no armário para colocar a mala (se não for muito grande). Karen foi super prestativa com dicas e informações sobre NYC, além de ter nos deixado bem à vontade para usar as dependências da casa - cozinha, sala, banheiro... O apartamento fica realmente bem perto, uns 3 min a pé no máximo, da Church Ave Station. Lá, você pega a linha 2 e em menos de 1 hora está nos principais lugares de NYC, por exemplo: Times Square - 40 min, Wall Street - 25 min, Central Park - 50 min. É um pouco longe, porém vale muito a pena pra quem quer conhecer NYC e gastar pouco!

Karen's place was very comfortable, clean and very convenient to subway stations. Karen was really friendly and helpful, She gave me information such as; good restaurant, broadway tickets, subway information etc.. Karen's is a nice host who helps you with any question. I highly reccomend karen's apartment!

Words can not express how thoroughly enjoyable my stay with Karen and Joshua was! They are the epitome of class. From their accommodating me at such last minute, to guiding me to the apartment (after I got lost at 11pm at night), down to the incredibly comfortable room. They made my stay enjoyable. Everything was laid out for me; keys, a/c, towels and linens, etc. They even left several Starbursts in the room once they saw that I had a sweet tooth :) Those two are very down to Earth, and their children are adorable! I'd recommend EVERYONE to stay there.

Karen and Joshua are very friendly people.  And their children are very charming (and so very, very quiet!).  Their place could not be any more convenient to the subway, which makes for an easy trip to Manhattan.  The sleeping room is very clean.  Thank you!

Quartier pas sécurisant à première vue. Evitez de vous y aventurer tard le soir. 
Appartement très propre. 
Karen, Joshua et leurs enfants sont cool mais on s' attendait à ce qu'il y ait plus d'échanges et qu'ils fassent un peu plus attention à nous, en nous proposant un café le matin par exemple, nous dire bonne nuit le soir (premier soir, une fois que Karen est arrivée, Joshua est parti dans sa chambre à 18h, et n'est plus resorti).
Etant français, nous n'avons pas l'habitude de ce genre de comportement.

My Stay at Private Cozy Bedroom in Brooklyn with Host Karen Wight Greenberg was Pleasant. It was a Comfy Room with  Clean Sheets.
   Very Helpful with Traveling Options.
Neighborhood was great because the subway and bus stops were right there. Welcomed me in and they are so great with their kids you can tell how loving this family is towards each other.

Karen, Joshua, Croc, Bel and JJ were lovely people to stay with. Karen was very accomodative and waited for me when my flight was delayed 3 hours and I had to have a late check in at around midnight.They were available and also kept checking with me to be sure that all was okay. My 20 month old really enjoyed playing with the kids. The room was as described. I loved the neighborhood because of the proximity to public transportation, supermarkets, shops and nice approachable people  willing to give directions whenever asked.

I had a great stay at Karen and Josh's place! The location was easy to travel to and from Manhattan/other areas of Brooklyn, and had places to eat nearby. It was a home away from home and their children are so cute! Being a female travelling by myself it was comforting to be in a family environment. They were happy to help with anything I needed (directions, etc) and I was given the space and freedom to do my own thing! Thankyou both for having me!

English coming

Nous avons passé un agréable séjour chez Karen, Joshua et leurs adorables enfants. La chambre est propre et très calme.
Karen et Joshua sont très sympathiques, ils ont toujours été disponibles pour nous et de bons conseils.
Le trajet en métro jusqu’à Manhattan est assez long, mais direct. L’arrêt de métro est à côté de l’appartement.

We had a pleasant stay with Karen, Joshua and their cute children. The room is clean and very quiet. 
Karen and Joshua are very friendly, they were always available for us and good advice. 
The subway ride to Manhattan is quite long, but direct. The metro stop is next to the apartment.

Karen was quick to reply and easy to communicate with so I had no troubles booking and arriving to the apartment on the agreed time. The listing description is really informative and detailed directions gave me no troubles arriving to the right place. Both Karen and Joshua were very welcoming and I felt as part of the family. I could use all the facilities and the room was comfy and spacious enough. The place is in easy reach of Brooklyn downtown and a reasonable Subway distance from Manhattan. I had spend a wonderful weekend in New York and I knew I had a safe place to comeback for the night. Would definitely come back again.
We had a great time at Karen and Josh's place. They were very kind and welcoming to us. The bedroom is small, but really comfy and totally fine. I'd recommend their place anytime.

Although we didn't get to meet Karen and her family, we had a lovely stay at their apartment. It's really ideally located, close to the subway, and was really easy to get to from Penn Station. The room, while small, features a very comfy bed. Karen was very easy to communicate with about the details of our arrival, and her neighbor was nice enough to check us in since Karen was out of town. Definitely recommended!

I had a great experience staying at Karen's place - the subway station is just less than 3 mins away and there are several grocery stores nearby. By taking the 2 line you can get to Wall Street in about 30 mins.  The room was clean and the bed was comfortable  - in short I had a good time staying at the apartment.

Karen and Josh were great hosts. They had a really nice apartment and a clean room. They were very accommodating with my visit with plenty of knowledge of the area and transit system. Karen was very fast with here Airbnb responses. This was my first Airbnb experience and they made it a positive experience. I would definitely recommend this nice apartment as a getaway!

Karen and Joshua were excellent hosts. They were extremely friendly and welcoming. They had a lot of knowledge about the city so were helpful when we needed help with directions. They have one adorable daughter and son as well as a friendly kitty.

It was extremely convenient that the subway stop was a block away from their house, as it was easy and safe to walk home late at night.

Great hospitality and would definitely recommend!
Very nice stay in Flatbush! The room and apartment was great. I felt very welcome there by the hosts Karen and Joshua. I would recommend staying there to anyone

Karen and Joshua are really nice people, and their two kids are adorable. They received us warmly, gave us lots of advice and told us interesting stories about themselves. Also, they tried to keep it as quiet as possible in the mornings, which is surely a challenge with two energetic little kids.
Their apartment is really close to the subway (about a 2min-walk), which will easily take you to other parts of Brookly and Manhattan.
There are two things that you should be aware of, however: the neighborhood seemed a  little rough to us, so that you should be careful at night. Since the walk from the subway to the flat is so short, it only bothered us the first night, when we were a little surprised at the number of policemen and shady people on the streets. 
Also, as it truthfully says in the description, the room is very small and a little problematic for two people with big luggage. It is not a place where you would want to hang out very much; which should not be a great issue either, if you know it in advance and plan to be out and about all day anyways.  
The whole apartment is rather small (it looks more spacious on the pictures), so that you have to feel comfortable with "intruding" on the family's much used living room, since the guest room is right next to it.

Our experience at karen's place was good,they are very helpful and very good people.
The wifi was bad and this was an issue for us other than that nothing was bad at our stay

Karen and Joshua were very kind and caring hosts. The room was clean and tidy, everything was like it was announced before. The flat was reachable by train very well, the train station only one block away from the house. We always felt safe in the neighboorhoud either. Recommended!

I had a wonderful three-night stay with Joshua and Karen. The room was very comfortable, and I thought it was plenty of space for one person with a few bags. The rest of the apartment is nice and comfy as well, and I appreciated that I was made to feel welcome to use the common areas when I was around. The apartment has only one bathroom but I never felt like there were any conflicts with getting time in the shower or anything. Location is fantastic--there's a subway station literally just round the corner and I found it very quick and easy to get into Manhattan every day. I honestly never felt all that uncomfortable with the neighborhood, as other reviews mentioned, but I guess that kind of thing is relative.

On top of all this, it really has to be said that this is just the nicest family. Karen and Joshua are so friendly and also really interesting people. I tend to be a little shy of strangers and sometimes find it stressful staying in a room in the home of a family I don't know, but Karen and Joshua never made me feel like I was intruding, and I had some really enjoyable conversations with them. Their two kids are also super cute and very precocious. 

I would absolutely recommend staying here, and would happily stay here again myself on any future visit to the area.

We had a great stay with Karen in the Flatbush neighborhood in Brooklyn. It is a very multicultural part of the city with an emphasis on Caribbean cultures. The room was clean and comfortable. Karen and Joshua were friendly and their kids were cute. Good communication, would stay with them again.

My experience staying with Karen and Joshua was great. I found the room to be comfortable and quiet. Even with their young children, the entire family worked towards keeping the noise down if I was still asleep. The home is delightful, warm and friendly. I felt welcome and able have privacy when I needed it. This listing is an oasis to come back to after a long day/night in the big city. It is easily accessible by subway, I felt safe in the neighbourhood, it took about 35/40 minutes to reach SOHO on average and although there were occasionally long waits when travelling back late at night, there were never any problems. I recommend this listing as your next place to stay in Brooklyn.

It was lovely to stay with this beautiful family! Everything is as discribed: I stayed alone and it was never a problem to come home late as the subway is running throughout the night. It is no problem to walk from the subway station to the appartment even at night as it is only one short block. The room is big and there´s enough space for two people. I also had the possiblity to use bath, kitchen and living room. Both and the lovely kids were around quite often and always happy to answer questions and give recommendations, especially for jazz (thank you so much, that was a great night!), broadway-shows and good places to eat! Thank you very much for everything!

I have booked two nights for my parents to stay at Karen's and Joshua's apartment. They enjoyed their time their and were very happy to meet such nice people. Even though my parents don't speak English , Karen and Joshua have helped them out with printing their boarding pass for the flight back and helped them stay in touch with me by using their PC and email account.
From what my parents told me, we can highly recommend to spend some nights and days at  Karen and Joshua's

I had a lovely time staying in Karen's apartment. I went over Thanksgiving weekend and they opened up their home to me. Although they were not there, Karen made sure I arrived okay and provided me with instructions about the kitchen, bathroom, trash/recycling, etc. She also had take-out menus in the room and also responded quickly to any questions I had. The room was exactly what I needed and located very close to the subway. All in all I had a great stay and hope to stay there again in the future.

Thank you very much for your help.
Manu felt at home during the days he spent at you place-
Thenk you fo being so welcoming and kind.
A great experience in Booklyn.
Totally reccomendable!!!!!!
it was my first experience with Airbnb. I liked everything Karen responsive and a great person. the next trip to NY necessarily use her bathroom. everything is fine. Thanks Karen

Well informed the location. host is responsible. felt cozy like my room. cute cat is there. children are so lovely and good at sing a song:) everything was good. if you are thinking of staying in here, there is no reason not to stay here.

Karen and Joshua are really nice and a hospitable couple! They have really cute kids too! 

Only one train ride to manhattan the place is perfect for couples looking at traveling and touring manhattan but want to stay away from the busy city! 

The location is perfect and the room is cosy and comfy! 

This is the place  to stay if you are in New York! 

Karen was exceptionally sweet with hosting us well though she was a little unwell. She and Joshua made sure we are comfortable and settled in. 

They were also very accommodating as we were a little last minute with the booking but we managed to Check in smoothly and were appreciative about it! 

Overall a great place with a lovely family!
Short stay, but very nice time. Feel comfortable and very nice apartment.

It was my very first Airbnb experience and I could not imagine this to be better!!! Karen and Joshua and their super cute kids made me feel very welcome! The room is small but it was warm (which was crucial due to really cold March in NYC). With the 5 you are in 30 minutes at Grand Central and with 2 in some 40 at Times Square. Really good connection (except at nights and weekends when 5 is not running). I would totally recommend staying with this super nice family!!
Great! Exactly what I hoped for!
It was my very first time to book room on Airbnb, Karen's house leave me a good impression. Although the room is small but it still make me comfortable and warm.

I stayed at Karen and Joshua's place for ten nights while in town for business. The room and apartment were exactly as described in the listing, with a positive surprise being the bed and blanket/duvet which were pretty much the best I've seen during my Airbnb stays (for me at least, your mileage may vary). The room is also one of the quietest I've stayed at in NYC with very little noise from the street and neighbors during the night, which was nice. The neighborhood is pretty good with all the basic services (convenience stores, bodegas, fast food, pharmacy etc) and the subway station nearby. Also, the 2 and 5 trains weren't too crowded even in rush hour. All in all, Karen and Joshua (and the kids) were wonderful hosts and I'll definitely be staying at their place in the future as well!
It was just a great stay! Karen & Joshua are very friendly and always open to give you an advice.

ce fut un très agréable séjour et des hôtes vraiment sympas dans un quartier de brooklyn ou j'avais mes habitudes pour mon breakfast en allant chez " donuts shop " juste à coté de l'appartement. j'y retournerai volontiers .    merci pour votre gentillesse et hospitalité.

it was a wonderful stay! I stayed in their place for 5 nights.

Karen and Joshua are very, very nice hosts. They provided everything I need and they even invited me for dinner during my last night. I enjoyed every conversation we had!

The kids and their cat were very cute. Although the subway station is rather away from downtown, the listing is just a block away from the station. There are lots of groceries stores and food on the way back to the place.

I'd definitely love to stay here again next time I'm in New York!
Karen and Josh were gracious hosts, helpful all the way through my short but enjoyable stay in Brooklyn.

We really enjoyed our stay at Karen & Joshuas place. From the beginning on we were warmly welcomed and felt being part of the family. We could ask anything @anytime and got great recommendations. Thanks a million times!! Hugs, Katharina & Stefan 
Nb: Yes, the area is safe and yes you can take the subway to get there- even during the evening. Just pay attention as you always should when strolling around in a city like New York.

The room is clean and cosy. It is fine for one person but two would be a bit of a squeeze. The room opens to the family's  living room and you will get a lot of free entertainment - the host sings and plays his guitar while his two adorable kids dance crazily- so it is value for money right there! It felt a bit intrusive on the hosts' family life being there, though the hosts are very friendly and helpful people. The flat is really near a subway station (with an elevator if you have luggage) and the neighbourhood disconcerted me at first as it looked a bit unsafe (host advised that the main streets are safe enough). I can't tell how safe it is at night as I never used the subway at night while I was there.

We stayed with Karen, Joshua and their adorable kids for 5 nights and it was such a pleasant stay at their appartment. The bedroom is small but comfy. The house is well connected to the subway and you've got grocerie stores just right next to it. So basically you've got everything you need here and we would definitely recommend it to people who are looking for a cosy spot in Brooklyn. :)

This was my second time staying at Karen's place, and everything went really well again. Actually even better than the first time as the room got a fridge which helped a lot. All in all highly recommended.

Karen and Joshua were friendly hosts who provided tips on what to see, where to eat and overall hospitable and kind. The room is a bit small for two people, but the bed was comfortable and the bath clean. Convenient for a budget crash pad in Brooklyn. The train does take about 40mins- 1 hour to get to parts of Manhattan from their subway stop (just one block away), so if you are looking to spend less time on the subway and more on the sights, this might not be the place.

My room was cosy, private, and had what I needed for a five-night-stay. The hosts were welcoming and helpful. The neighborhood was ok, cornerstores nearby and subway to Manhattan within very short walking distance. Would recommend to anyone traveling on a budget and focusing on the sights, shopping & culture of NYC and not the nightlife :)

What a great place to stay! I only met Karen on my first day because she went on vocation by herself. But she was super nice and helped me with everything. And thank you for all your great advices! 
The appartment is perfectly when you travel alone. You will find everything there. The grocery store is around 1 min away and also the metro is around the corner. You need a little time to get into the city. But it is definitely okay.
It was great to stay there!

The stay at Karen&Joshua was awesome -even though I could not meet them, they texted detailed instructions which were so helpful for a solo traveler. The room was comfortable enough for myself, and I even got to use a mini frige all by myself as well! Their lovely cat, JJ was so friendly that I did not feel lonely haha. Thank you so much guys!!

I've only get to meet up with Karen, Joshua and Crockett for about 2 - 3 days in the week that I was staying. However, they left clear instructions and were contactable via mobile.

The room is sufficient enough for 1 person and the place is very near the subway. Getting to downtown takes around 35 mins and there are food and groceries nearby too. It's really a convenient place to stay.

Our stay at Karen's has been a pleasant experience. Due to her commitment, Karen was not around when we arrived but she has prepared everything (direction, keys, bedsheet, guide) we would need to ensure a smooth checkin. And a smooth one it was. 
The place is just a 3' walk away from Church Av. , which has a direct Subway line to key areas in Manhattan. It is well kept, clean, tidy and quiet, perfect as a rest place to return to everyday.

We had a great stay! We saw Karen only once, but she gave us good information. The room was small, but the bed comfortable. Nice to have airco, although it made a lot of noise (we used earplugs). A lot of shops around the corner. Very close to subway that brings you to Manhattan in 20-30 minutes. Recommended!

Everything was good except the neighbor. Subway station is just a min by walk from the house which is perfect location but we need to very careful in the nights to walk just a min. The area looks not a safe place but except that everything was good. Room was little bit small to put two people s luggage but it was fine :) Kitchen, shower room, air conditioner were very convenient and the subway takes 35 min to timesquare without transfer !

Karen's apartment is really nice and cozy. We stayed there for 5 nights and had a good time. Everything was already prepared (bed sheets, towels, WiFi password, ...) when we arrived and Karen was always reachable for questions. The subway is just 200m away which is very convenient to get to Manhatten. It's an ideal place for a short stay in New York and I can definitely recommend it.
Great place, Karen organizes their house so wrll. I love her cat and kid.

This was a good a good inexpensive option if you're willing to travel to get to the things you want to see. It's a very diverse community, with a large Afro Caribbean community. It did take me a while to get home late at night after shows when trains are running less frequently so it made for some late nights. They do have kids and a cat, so if you're not doing sharing your space with either creature, not a good fit for you. They were very nice and responsive and the bed was comfy. It was in the 90s when I was there and I didn't even have to run my window unit AC if I kept the blinds pulled during the day. The fan was fine.

Karen welcomed us when we get there. She is friendly.
but the room is quite small that just one large bedroom fit in.
the location is near metro but the neighborhood is quite unsafe and it took 40~50minutes to get to manhattan or so.

It was nice to stay in Karen's home. It was funny that we meet each other in the elevator of my way. It was a interesting journey. Karen's two kids are so cute!!  She helped us to call the Uber to airport, she is helpful for everything. I would like to stay with her  again.
Realmente me senti muy comoda, Karen y Josh muy amables y cordiales, los ninos encantadores! El barrio extremadamente seguro. El cuarto comodo y acogedor...hacia dificil poder levantarse!!!

Had a wonderful time staying with Karen and Joshua! We only got to meet Joshua and the little one briefly but they were very friendly and had a lot of great tips exploring the city. We had a clean and cozy room, everything was exactly the way they described it in the description. I would stay with them again!
It's very good. And the kids are lovely.

Karen and Joshua were great hosts! The communication beforehand and also during my stay was just excellent! Unfortunately I didn't get to meet Karen in person as she was out of town during my stay but Joshua looked after my wellbeing, making sure I was fine, recommending restaurants and giving all the useful tips you might need when staying in New York! Their kids were just adorable and "JJ" the cat got loads of extra cuddles from me :-) Karen and Joshua's home is exactly as described: 40-45mins by Subway into Manhattan (Midtown: Times Square, Theatre District ...), their place being actually located right in the 'heart of Brooklyn' gave me sort of a suburban feeling with its own vibes and even tranquillity as I barely heard any street noise at all ... waking up to birds singing in the trees and someone playing a piano lovingly in the distance is quite unusual in a City like New York, so that was a real treat during my stay!!! The bed was extremely comfortable, I overslept not only once during my eight-day-stay with them and having the luxury of 'my very own little fridge' in my room was definitely another Highlight!!! Travelling to and from Manhattan by Subway is really easy and I always felt safe ... even late at night or at 4am in the morning hours walking home all by myself, no need to feel unsafe at all! The Subway Station is located right around the corner (3min walk from Karen and Joshua's home!) and has also elevators which comes in handy when you're carrying heavy luggage! All in all I've had a fantastic stay at their place and can highly recommend it to anyone who likes to enjoy living on the other side of the Hudson :-)

We enjoyed our stay very much: lovely hosts! Joshua and Karen gave us a feeling of home, with happy kids. They gave us good advice to explore NY culturally.
Further: the shower was good! The area 'Brooklyn Flatbush' was awesome: close to subway station, the carribean atmosphere and the nice people in the hood!
We just needed a little bit more space for our luggage, and a more comfortable mattress too.

Karen and Joshua were great hosts, they made us feel really comfortable un their house and were really nice to us too. The room is not huge but is really good for two people, just one block away from the subway and located un a golf neighborhood full of markets and stores. We would definitely recommend it!

The room is very cozy, clean and private and its even possible to lock the room door if desired. The bed was comfortable with a clean set of bedding on it and I got fresh set of towels. Apartment is well organized and bathroom was always accessible. Hosts are wonderful and very accommodating. Apartment is a block away from the 2 and 5 train station. I also enjoyed walking to the prospect park and walking around the park all the way to Grand Army plaza and Brooklyn Museum. Overall I liked my stay.

Karen and Joshua are excellent hosts! They are very friendly and welcoming. They had excellent recommendations of local gems and spots to see.  They're home is warm and full of life! When we arrived, we were immediately welcomed by the friendly Greenberg family. They are respectful of space and privacy, and their children were very well behaved! 

Our room was very comfortable. We had an adjustable bed that would be transformed into a twin size if we needed more space. We were provided with a large closet and drawers to unpack in. We also had  a mini fridge, which was great for leftovers so that we could save money for meals.  

The location of the BNB was very close to the subway station which made it very easy to get around. We were also just a few steps away from city buses that could take you all over to different neighborhoods of Brooklyn! For cyclists, the Citi Bike Rentals are more concentrated in downtown Brooklyn which is a short subway ride away. Brooklyn has great cycling lanes that make you feel safe travelling on two wheels. 

The neighborhood is culturally rich with a wide variety of sights, sounds and smells! If you love Caribbean food, you will have plenty of options to choose from!  

This BNB was an excellent opportunity to observe REAL life in New York.

I had a great time, Karen and Joshua were great host I even met their kids. It's a perfect location to stay at, around the corner from the subway. And they are right by little shops like Walgreens and subway for a fast place to eat or a late night snack run. This was my first time using Airbnb and I'm glad I had a great experience with nice hostess.

I had a great stay! The apartment is literally a minute's walk from the subway. The room was clean and comfortable, with a mini fridge if you need it. Karen and Joshua were super friendly. I would definitely book this place again the next time I visit NYC.

Karen and Joshua are amazing hosts! Their place is clean and very accommodating. The room is very cozy, clean, and exactly like described. Apartment is a block away from the 2 and 5 train station. I also enjoyed walking in the neighborhood to prospect park and the area. Karen and Joshua were super friendly and more than willing to suggest things to do in NYC. I would definitely book this place again the next time I visit NYC.

Karen and Joshua were both so welcoming and accommodating. They were happy to answer any questions and give recommendations for things to do in NYC. The location of their home is also very convenient as it is a short walk from the 2 and 5 subway line. Would definitely stay here again!

Great hosts. Their apartment is very close to the subway which takes you to almost everywhere you would want to be in New York City. There is a private refrigerator in the bedroom which helps a lot for storing your drinks or snacks in. Overall I had a very pleasant stay at their home.

Un accueil agréable, une charmante famille. Malgré le court séjour, nous avons pu échanger avec Karen et son mari qui ont répondu à nos questions, et donné quelques petits conseils. Une "cohabitation" facilitée par des règles qui font simplement appel au bon sens. Point positif également, le métro est très proche (5min à pied pas plus), et accessibilité à deux lignes de métro.

Karen and Joshua were great host. They have a beautiful family and well-behaved children. Apartment is cute and cozy. The room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. Location was great. 2,5 MTA station is 1 block away (2 min walk) and amazing Caribbean food nearby. A short 8 minute walk to SUNY Downstate University Hospital. I would recommend this place to anyone!

This is a nice, loving home located a corner from the subway (2,3) and this subway has an elevator. Karen and Joshua offer great conversation and a clean abode. The subway near their place has an elevator and the condo building does not - but no worries it's just one flight of stairs. The neighborhood is awesome and various food options. the refrigerator in the bedroom is a nice touch. Thanks for being great host. Very safe in and out of their area and quaint coffee shops and eateries within 100 - 200 feet.
Beautiful home and lovely host with adorable kids!

Karen and company made me feel so welcome. Their children are fantastic and well-behaved. I felt cozy and right at home in this room. In a great location and easy to navigate. I would definitely recommend staying here during your trip.

Accueil chaleureux et convivial, on se sent vite aussi à l'aise que chez soi chez Karen. Vous croiserez sûrement deux adorables enfants. L'appartement est vraiment bien situé, à 2 min du métro, qui nous amène directement en plein Manhattan. Le quartier est  vivant et animé je recommande.
The stay was awesome! The room is private and cozy, and Karen is very helpful and nice :)

Karen and Joshua were wonderful hosts -- very hospitable and accommodating. Joshua was extremely resourceful in sight-seeing suggestions and helping me getting around Brooklyn and Manhattan which, as a first-timer in NYC, was very kind and valuable. The snuggery was clean and functional. Fantastic experience :)

The stay was comfortable as my home.
Also i can use refrigerator in my room
It's very good, i bought some fruits and ate them whenever i wanted in my room!-!

Karen's family is harmonious,
So i felt safe during my stay

The house was very clean and cozy

I recommend this house to everyone !
(I stayed 3 kinds of house through airbnb, 
Karen's house was very good among them :->)

Mon séjour chez Karen et Joshua a été très agréable. Accueil chaleureuse, ils sont là si vous avez besoin de recommandations et de bons plans. Si vous voulez voir un show à Broadway, demandez à Karen, elle saura vous aider et peut-être même vous donner des réductions. 
Chambre et appartement très bien, situé à deux minutes du métro. Comptez 40min pour aller à Time Square. 
Je recommande cette chambre si vous avez un petit budget.
当晚七点到布鲁克林, 从church st.到房东家步行约五分钟｡房东人很好,房间很干净｡房东很乐意与大家交谈,晚上大家会聚在客厅聊天,最后一天离开时,还帮忙查看路线信息｡难忘的一次AirBNB经历,感谢Karen一家人为Tracy和我安排这两天的住宿｡

Karen and Joshua were very accommodating on meeting up for check in. They had the rules laid out upon check in and were helpful with any questions. During the visit, both were respectful of my privacy, made me feel like I was at home and were quite social. They even offered some good points of interest for coffee, food and pizza. I highly recommend them if you're trying to stay in the Brooklyn area.
We had a great experience staying at Karen's place in Brooklyn. The location was great, and Karen and her family were very hospitable.

This Brooklyn apartment is perfectly located for accommodation outside of Manhattan. The subway station is a quick walk away. Karen and Joshua were very helpful and friendly - they are resourceful and happy to help make your stay comfortable. The flat is comfortable and the fridge in the room is an added bonus. Thanks for hosting me ;)

We had a rough start to our stay at Karen and Josh's. We arrived at their house at 10:30pm after a full day of traveling (it was at that point 4:30am where we woke up). When we arrived we buzzed and called both Karen and Josh and banged on the door, but it ended up being an hour before we heard back from them and were let in. Karen was at work which we knew, but it turns out Josh was inside sleeping and didn't hear our repetitive knocks or his phone going off.

After we finally got settled everything was fine. Karen seems nice, didn't interact with Josh as much. The apartment is just a block from the 2 and 5 trains which go right into Manhattan in 20-30 minutes. Not a great neighborhood but we didn't plan on spending time there anyway. The apartment had everything we needed. The feature of the bed pulling out to a queen is nice and convenient, though there's not much more space in the room when it is out. There was a bit of just cosmetic mold in the shower.

For the price the stay was worth it. And I would hope that our arrival was just a mishap, but after such a long day and much communication, the additional delay was hard to get past.

Excelente lugar. Cómodo, super limpio y muy cerca de la estación de metro.
Karen & Joshua muy amables y cordiales, preocupados en cada momento de tener una buena estadía.
¡De seguro volvería!

Great palce. Confortable, very clean and close to the metro station.
Karen & Joshua always worried about have a good stay
For sure I'd come back!
I had a really enjoyable stay with Karen and Josh. They were warm and welcoming - I felt very comfortable. I also enjoyed the conversations that we had. Recommended hosts!

I can totally recommend staying at Karen's and Joshua's place. Unfortunately, I never got to met them personally, but Karen was always there to help me on the phone. Even when I wanted to stay a night longer than actually planned, she made everything possible. Big thanks again to Karen! The cleaning guy as well as the supervisor, who is living next door, are also very nice people and there to help if you need something. However, from city guides to bath items, everything is already provided. The place is just a one minute walk away from the subway which takes you to Manhattan in around 30 minutes. Moreover, I totally felt save in the area and like at home at Karen's place. Definitely worth a stay!

It was our first step in Brooklyn ! Unfortunately we didn't get to meet Karen in person, but she was always there to help us or answer my questions by email. By the way, we fell in love with "JJ" the cat, the perfect roommate ! This apartment is located very closed from the subway station. The flat is comfortable and there is a fridge in the room!  We stayed there for 2 nights and everything was already prepared (sheets, towels, WiFi password). 
Thanks for hosting us !

Karen & Joshua were awesome hosts. Even if they haven't been around, they stayed in touch with me to make sure everything is alright.
Also, it's a great apartment in the heart of Brooklyn and JJ, the cat is adorable! =)

Karen and Joshua was so NICE and HELPFUL. This is my first time to live in an Airbnb, and they accept my applicaion without any hesitation. Also, there house is so lovely and basicly you can get everything you need. It is quite close to the subway, which makes it easier to travel around. Karen also recommend some places that you can have meals. Overall, this is a highly recommended place to live when you would like to travel in NYC!

The apartment was cozy and nice. I was a bit disappointed I never saw the family as I was looking forward to a bit of community during my stay but they were in Jersey. Despite that, the super let me in and was very kind and helpful, the cat was charming and I felt lucky the other boarded was very nice. (at first I was nervous about staying in a house with a person I hadn't reviewed but I was lucky he was very kind). I was unknowledgeable about NYC geography and had a hard time finding that my commute to my conference in east village was about 50 minutes long and the place was about a 45 minute cab ride from Times Square.  If you are staying here just know to expect that. The apartment is only a short walk to the subway entrance which is very convenient and also good as sometimes it felt a bit sketchy in the neighborhood later at night. Karen was a good communicator and was good at answering any questions promptly.

Karen & Joshua are SO nice,friendly, helpful to discover the NYC, and great in communicate. The place is one block from a train station - Don't worry about walk-able distance. the place was clean. I recommend Karen place for sure!

Without any previous hosting feedback on my profile, Karen accepted me with no hesitations, gave me directions and suggestions before I arrive (first time in NY), many recommendations for places around the area.

The room is very good, comes with a small fridge, clean bed covers and towels were prepared for me.

Regarding communication, Karen is #1, she never leaves a question or message with no reply.

The place is very easy to be reached by train, it was my first time in NY,  and with the instructions from Karen, I was able to arrive there with no problems.

Highly recommended listing! Thank you Karen

The place was great, in a mostly Jamaican/WestIndies neighborhood with places to eat and a Walgreens really close by. It also had a metro just 3-4 min walking, this metro did NOT run on weekends and that was a down because we had to travel in bus everywhere. The family was not home for the weekend but their apartment was pretty and clean. Karen was quick to respond to any questions I had over my stay. They have a beautiful cat named JJ and that really made my stay feel like I was at home.

The Hosts: Karen and Joshua were wonderful. Karen was especially flexible with my changing plans, and made it possible to check in when they weren't around. If you have a chance to meet this wonderful couple, they made me feel like family! 

The Room: exactly what I was looking for. Affordable, private, air conditioned room. The apartment was quaint and the cat makes good company!
Great stay!!

The host was very warm and friendly. The room that we reserved was alright for us just remember to travel light! The place was clean and neat when we got there. Karen also filled us in with what we can do around the neighborhood and what not. Also, the subway is literally just 5 minutes of walk so getting around is not an issue. There's really nothing I could complain about, definitely a nice place to be if you're looking for a place to stay in Brooklyn.

I felt really at home at Karen and Joshua and can definately recommend a stay at their place

It's a simple yet comfortable room in a lovely decorated flat.

Karen and Joshua are wonderful caring people and the communication was easy and not complicated

Thumbs up =)

Muy conveniente lugar, la estación del metro queda a dos cuadras del apartamento lo cual es excelente para llegar tarde en la noche como siempre pasa en NY, Karen y Joshua son muy atentos a cualquier pregunta o duda sobre cómo llegar a diferentes lugares, el cuarto es pequeño pero cómodo, tiene un pequeño refrigerador y el baño es muy limpio, tiene wifi y se puede utilizar la cocina para preparar cosas mínimas, excelente servicio.
They are friendly family and their house is adorable. It's very close to the subway     . Everything is great.

We had a very nice and pleasant stay at Karen and Joshua place. They both did everything to welcome us in their home. Kids are adorable and JJ the cat loves cuddle. The room is nice with its own fridge and bed is comfy. Close to Church Av subway station which is very convenient ! Thanks to them we had an awesome NYC trip.

My stay with Karen and Joshua was fantastic. They were very gracious hosts. Great communication about check in and were available to answer any questions I had.  This is the place I'll stay next time I come to NYC. Its like coming home.

Karen took care of my arrival before my departure from Tokyo how to get to the place and provided me all information I needed. Joshua helped me to have fun in Brooklyn. I stayed 2 days safely and I could know how amazing in Brooklyn. 
The place is very convenient, very close to the station, supermarket etc. 
I would recommend here to everyone who would like to know Brooklyn.
I enjoyed staying at their place. The room was clean and had everything I needed.

I very much enjoyed staying with Karen and Joshua, they were great hosts and made me feel welcome in their home. The apartment is super close to the subway that takes you straight to Manhattan and to other Brooklyn neighborhoods. Karen provided me with information on Broadway shows, where to get tickets, which shows are good....thanks to this info I was able to get tickets for a great show! 
I would definitely stay there again.
par l'accueil qui était chaleureux et la gentillesse du service qu'ils nous ont rendu.

I didn't have a lot of interaction with them, since I wasn't actually there very much, but they were a lovely family - very nice, with adorable and well-behaved kids.  Karen had left a very helpful and detailed printout with information about restaurants, airport transport info, etc.

Karen's place was very convenient for me, it was very close to the subway station. The neighborhood is a typical residential area, so you need to take a subway for eating or sightseeing. The room was clean and exactly how she described, however, the sound of TV from the living room was a little too loud at night.

We had a wonderful stay! A great value for the money and a perfect place to crash after walking around the city all day. The place is conveniently located, very close to a Subway station which makes it really easy to get to Manhattan or any other point of interest. Karen and Josh are very nice, friendly and accommodating hosts. They know a lot about the city events and places giving us a lot of great recommendations. We really enjoyed our time in New York and would definitely like to stay here again in the future.
Karen and Joshua were excellent hosts. They made me feel like part of their family. I would definitely stay here again.

Staying with Karen and her family felt just like home! Her family was very welcoming, and also invited me to their Thanksgiving dinner as I was away from my family. Conversations were great! Overall, my experience was great at Karen and Joshua's place. Location is ideal as well, close to supermarkets, train station, and the gym im a member was conveniently located 9 mins away! Would definitely recommend!

Karen and Josh were amazing! I felt right at home from the moment I took my shoes off at the door. I had a late check-in; but communicating with Karen was not a problem. She waited up for me so that I could get the keys to their place and my room! The kids were adorable and very polite. Room was clean, bed was comfy, floor could use a little cleaning, but that's it. THE LOCATION IS EVERYTHING! If you really would like to explore Brooklyn, where everything is walking distance, (subway too) this is the spot for you! Thanks Karen & Josh!!! I would love to stay here again! :)

When Brian Chesky founded Airbnb in 2008 I can only presume that the experience I had staying with Karen and Joshua for two nights was what he had in mind: Accommodating, prompt and welcoming. Above all, it's clear that both have a genuine love and hard-earned knowledge on the city.  If you're visiting New York for any reason staying with Joshua and Karen will help you understand what makes the city such a magical place.
Very accommodating. Very organized and detailed. Clean house.

Karen's home was great. Sadly I didn't get to meet her and family during my short stay, but I was always extremely welcomed! Karen's awesome friend Rachel (and I truly mean awesome) did everything to keep the place perfect and help me with anything I needed! Communicating with them is very smooth. The place is very cozy, clean and quiet. I definitely recommend it if you would like to explore Brooklyn for it's dynamic life. It is located very close to a subway station and bus stop, with many pharmacies stores and shops around (try the local Nostrand Donut Shop for breakfast and donuts!). Their cat JJ is adorable and unlike most other cats, tends to keep to himself (so if you're not used to cats, I still recommend this place). PS. He loves cuddle time on the couch :) Thank you Karen, family, and especially Rachel for having me! Happy holidays!!
Had a great stay!  Location is close to Prospect Park and the apartment was beautiful and well ordered.  Thank you for a great stay!

I had a nice stay in this cozy (Website hidden by Airbnb) is a clean, silent (Website hidden by Airbnb) can have nice (Website hidden by Airbnb) is convenient, close to common stores and the train station.Thank you Rachel for your hospitality.

Didn't get to meet the host but Rachel (the lady who helped with checked in) was lovely and very helpful. The room was exactly as described, cosy and bed was massive for two people (although taken up the majority of space in the room). Their cat is very well-behaved and adorable! Travel to Manhattan was straightforward and takes about 40 minutes.

I was comfortable, and it was a pretty room.
A cat is cute‼,︎.

I stayed here for two nights. Had a wonderful time. Couldn't get to met the actual hosts but there was a very nice lady who coordinated so well. It is separate apartment just for Airbnb guests. You don't get to meet host often so I enjoyed my privacy. If there are no other Airbnb guests, you can enjoy the whole place with a fancy kitchen and washroom. Just to keep you company there will be a cat always in the living room. 
The only issue I had was the parking. You will find a spot 4 blocks away after spending an hour during busy hours. I'll recommend not to keep a car but that is the problem with all of the Brooklyn.  My favorite thing was the area around. You can access each and every thing within a 5 mins walk.
Karen and Joshua provided a great place to stay. They were incredibly flexible during a tight and fluid situation and were excellent hosts. Cannot recommend more highly.
Karen and her family were warm and welcoming. Loved staying with her and hope to do it again next time I'm in NYC.
The room was as described and Karen and Joshua were very welcoming and helpful.

It was very nice to stay at Karen and Joshua's apartment.
Everything is clean, it is a cozy place and they are very
friendly.

Also, they live near the metro so you can easily travel from Brooklyn to Manhattan.

Thank you for the nice stay.
Perfect ! Karen and Joshua are very nice. It's a great place for a trip in NYC.

Karen and Joshoa are amazing hosts, the room is a bit small but convenient, there is a small fridge in the room and a space in the closet.. the apartment is a bit far away from midtown but its accessible by subway easily in 40 mins
Karen is an excellent host! Helpful information when you need it, out of your hair when you don't.

Karen and Joshua have an amazing atmosphere that is welcoming and comforting. They live one street away from the 2 train. I was lucky enough to witness the giving of thanks on their Jewish Sabbath, which is a Friday. It was an amazing experience.
Really enjoyed my stay here Joshua and Karen are amazing people and helped me with everything I needed will be coming back if I come to Brooklyn again!
Estuvo muy bien, una zona muy segura y con fácil acceso, con mercados muy muy cerca. La casa muy limpia y Karen y Joshua muy amables. El cuarto tiene una nevera privada muy útil.
Un super séjour chez Karen et Joshua. Ils sont géniaux et ouverts à la discussion. La chambre est propre, on a un petit frigo et une penderie. On partage leur vie de famille c'est vraiment top

Karen y Joshua son muy atentos con uno como huésped y se ocupan que la estadía sea básicamente correcta teniendo en cuenta que implica la convivencia con ellos incluídos los niños. El lugar queda alejado de los lugares centrales de Brooklin pero el metro pasa a una cuadra lo que facilita la conección. Básicamente fue una buena experiencia
Everything!
Great location and super close to subway. Easy check in and works for a couple nights for a place to sleep.

Karen was very nice and helpful all the way. She helped me in any request that I asked, was friendly and nice.
The place located very close to a Subway station in Brooklyn. The room is cozy and quiet, there is AC in the room. The location itself is about 35 mins from Manhattan.

Karen's place is very convenient in the sense, the subway station is just one block away. Though I did not meet her in person, there is another host which help to organise the check in and out and was nice to allow me to keep my luggage in the living till 6pm as I have a late night flight. Overall I had a pleasant stay there.
Very close to the subway stop and was a good stay for the price offered.

A casa possui uma boa infra-estrutura. Quarto com ar, banheiro e cozinha equipada. Atende as pessoas que buscam um lugar tranquilo para aproveitar, quem gosta de cozinhar e as pessoas que apenas buscam um lugar para descansar ao final de um dia intenso conhecendo tds os lugares de NY. Estação de metrô ao lado, facilitou bastante os passeios.

My daughter stayed in Karen's apartment for 3 weeks and had great time in Brooklyn. Location was perfect walking distance to subway and hospital. Karen and Jess were great hosts, always helpful from the booking till checkout. Apartment is beautiful, clean and great value in terms of location. Highly recommendable. Will definitely stay here again when we visit NYC. Thank you so much Karen, Jess and JJ (the gorgeous cat!) for making my daughter stay safe, comfortable and enjoyable. Warmest regards
Lovely, comfortable home and very helpful, welcoming host!

Unfortunately I didn't meet Karen and her family because they were on vacation too, but Jess hosted me and she is really nice. She provided me with towels and I could ask her everything. The apartment is well located for sightseeing and all around are some shops. You can reach for example the upper West side in one hour with the subway. And it's only 30 minutes away from JFK with the taxi. I enjoyed my stay would definitely choose this room again.
Location is close to the subway to navigate around the city. Good price for a room.
Karen is such a great  host, very accommodating .  I love it that the place is one block away from the subway station. I will definitely go back and recommend this place.

Karen is a great hostess, very accesible and kind.  

The place is good, clean and the location is perfect, near to touristic places. 
 
Thanks a lot, everything was good! Nice to meet you! We enjoy NYC in your awesome location.

Foi minha primeira experiência no Airbnb, e gostei bastante. A infraestrutura do apartamento é boa, pra uma pessoa o quarto estava ok, possui ar condicionado, armário e uma mini geladeira. Os dois (Karen e Joshua) são bem comunicativos. O local é realmente bem perto do metro, uma quadra. Para chegar em Manhattan, dependendo do lugar de 35 a 50 minutos. Foi uma boa experiência, eu recomendaria :).
Nice place to stay, easy access to metro and bus, direct trains to city center and Brooklyn. Also the proximity of Prospect Park allows enjoying running in the area
Excellent stay, great location near subway. Great tips for spending time around Brooklyn.
good room to be living.I think I will be rebooking if I went to NYC again

Karen and her family are excellent hosts! Their place is in a great location too; very close to the trains and lots of places to eat. They are super sweet people and I felt completely safe staying there. They were incredibly accommodating to my late check in time and we had a lot of great conversations during my stay. Would highly recommend!
Flew in for an interview and stayed an extra night. They were very gracious hosts and had great recommendations. Would definitely stay again if I’m ever back in town!
Great place! Owners gave great suggestions on things to do and places to eat!

Lovely apartment and a lovely family. Joshua knows the subway like the back of his hand and helped me a lot. Church Ave was a block away and everything you need was local . The area is lively but I felt safe even late at night , the subway was a dream to use and very cheap and great to get to Manhattan etc. Can’t think of a negative, I even learned how to use their Kurig so plenty of tea if you want it,although you couldn’t starve with all the places for breakfast etc

I really don’t want to give away my secret spot here in Brooklyn at Karen’s place. Karen & her husband, Joshua, are wonderful hosts. They have great suggestions of things to do should you need ideas. Their place is VERY conveniently located near the subway. A great value, comfortable place to call home while away from home and at a price you can actually afford!

Karen and Joshua are so friendly and helpful! Their apartment is cute, easily accessible, and close to the subway as well as a number of shops and places to grab a bite to eat. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would stay here again in the future!
Another wonderful stay at Karen & Josh’s home. Very convenient, as described, comfortable, clean ...
It was a great experience. I highly recommend this place.
Joshua and Karen are great hosts. My bed was comfy and quiet, and conversations were interesting with them. I would stay here again without a doubt.

とてもﾌﾚﾝﾄﾞﾘｰで､優しく､

知り合いの家にﾎｰﾑｽﾃｲに来たような感覚でした｡
